text: Ahhh, the smooth David Wise sound. This puzzle game looks like a good time, supported by a clean look and solid music. This theme is my favorite, though it's not surprising since Wise has mastered the art of creating water themes.
author: SupraDarky

text: I was like, wow this totally sounds like a Donkey Kong music. Then scroll down and yeah.
author: weeeekt

text: Hi SD, hope this finds you well. I just have a quick question as to why you don't put your commentary on the tracks in the description? I've been looking at some of your older posts, and I can no longer find what you had to say about the song and the game because it's been buried by more recent comments! I feel it's a shame that it's so hard to find your comments on the video, cause they always make me think differently about the song.
author: BombOmbBuddy

text: A short soundtrack, but it is golden!
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: More like David Tribe am|right?
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: I do this for 2 reasons. The first is that I want the description to stay clean of my personal opinions and strictly provide quick information and links to the other tracks. The second is that it promotes interaction and other comments from you guys. I only started commenting on each upload later in the list, so it's normal if you don't find any in the earlier ones.
author: SupraDarky

text: One of my favorite games. And this is probably my favorite song from it!

text: very nice free-style, light song.

text: What a relaxing tune! Just the perfect song to go deep diving and explore the depth's of the sea.

text: amazing

text: I think the point is that it's meant to be strange - the way the snake works is not something anyone's really tried before.

text: You mean all your life!
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: This game looks great. I just wish they made a version that has better controls (haven't played but apparently they're not great) and that doesn't feel so repetitive, with a more different world design.
author: Alfonso ST

text: Alfonso ST how do you wish for this without having played it? that's the stupidest thing I've read all day
author: Darqoni

text: Have you ever heard the description of something in a game and you dislike it so much you don't even want to play it? I see you've not.
author: Alfonso ST

text: Yesss this so much Supra!! This is the first song on the soundtrack that really hooked me. The other world themes are great too!
author: 8-Bit Alchemy

text: It's not fair to compare Wise's work on this with his other stuff since Snake Pass has only like six tracks, but those six tracks are in my opinion fucking flawless and just as good as his dkc stuff, no doubt
author: Mr. Tulip

text: David Wise, the king of underwater themes! Thanks for uploading this song!
author: MindReader

text: I wholeheartedly agree that Wise has mastered creating ambient and memorable water themes.  As a big fan of Wise's music in the early DKC games, I've always admired his body of work and this water theme is no exception.
author: Eric C.

text: It sounds like a cast-off from Tropical Freeze.
author: jb1980ist

text: I feel like that's almost certainly what it is. It just sounds so similar.
author: drunyon214

text:
drunyon214 
It's just Wise's style! Is it really such a bad thing? I mean: The track is awesome, that's the only thing that matters, right? :)
author: Kniffel101

text: Sounding similar to Tropical Freeze is not a bad thing; it's a very good thing!
author: drunyon214

text: Ever since 2014, David rocks this new style like nobody else!
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: Game had some interesting mechanics, but I'll admit, the music is the only reason I played it for as long as I did. Great stuff
author: CRS
